[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Virtual Company Dossier (VCD) defines requirements for secure and interoperable eProcurement, enabling structured document management and compliance tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: VCD integrates with eIDAS providers, procurement platforms, and regulatory compliance tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: VCD provides multilingual dashboards for document submission, validation, and tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: VCD operates on cloud-based infrastructure, secure edge servers, and local storage solutions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: VCD supports REST APIs for interoperability with document repositories and digital identity services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: VCD ensures encrypted data exchange using HTTPS and secure eIDAS-compliant protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: VCD optimizes memory usage to handle large procurement dossiers efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: VCD is configurable for regional procurement policies and regulatory frameworks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: VCD connects with compliance registries for real-time document validation and audit logging.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 MISSING-TAG2: VCD ensures 24/7 availability with automated updates and maintenance scheduling.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: VCD facilitates document authentication, real-time dossier updates, and seamless regulatory compliance across procurement platforms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for procurement officials, regulatory auditors, and enterprise vendors with minimal technical expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: VCD depends on secure authentication services and stable network connectivity for optimal performance.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: eIDAS: EU regulation governing electronic identification, authentication, and trust services for secure transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: VCD requires operational eIDAS providers and adherence to standardized document formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 MISSING-TAG1: VCD enables dossier creation, compliance verification, and secure procurement document exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with eIDAS providers and compliance registries for validation, authentication, and regulatory data exchange.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable users to create and update dossiers dynamically (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support compliance tracking and reporting (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall generate dossiers within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 2,000 concurrent users during peak usage.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store dossiers and user data.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support version control, role-based access, and encrypted storage for sensitive procurement data.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically for growing user bases and log critical activities for auditing.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modular architecture principles.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 for data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with European eProcurement guidelines and meet GDPR requirements for data privacy.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide multilingual guided workflows for dossier management.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Dossier creation tests, compliance tracking accuracy, and system scalability benchmarks.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, workflow guidelines, and API documentation for system integration.
[SEC] 5. References: eIDAS regulation, GDPR guidelines, and ISO 27001 security standards.
